location: Britain. The garden of Cymbelines palace.

lines.text: Enter two Gentlemen

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: You do not meet a man but frowns: our bloods No more obey the heavens than our courtiers Still seem as does the king.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: But whats the matter

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: His daughter, and the heir ofs kingdom, whom He purposed to his wifes sole sona widow That late he marriedhath referrd herself Unto a poor but worthy gentleman: shes wedded Her husband banishd she imprisond: all Is outward sorrow though I think the king Be touchd at very heart.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: None but the king

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: He that hath lost her too so is the queen, That most desired the match but not a courtier, Although they wear their faces to the bent Of the kings looks, hath a heart that is not Glad at the thing they scowl at.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: And why so

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: He that hath missd the princess is a thing Too bad for bad report: and he that hath her I mean, that married her, alack, good man! And therefore banishdis a creature such As, to seek through the regions of the earth For one his like, there would be something failing In him that should compare. I do not think So fair an outward and such stuff within Endows a man but he.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: You speak him far.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: I do extend him, sir, within himself, Crush him together rather than unfold His measure duly.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: Whats his name and birth

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: I cannot delve him to the root: his father Was calld Sicilius, who did join his honour Against the Romans with Cassibelan, But had his titles by Tenantius whom He served with glory and admired success, So gaind the suraddition Leonatus And had, besides this gentleman in question, Two other sons, who in the wars o the time Died with their swords in hand for which their father, Then old and fond of issue, took such sorrow That he quit being, and his gentle lady, Big of this gentleman our theme, deceased As he was born. The king he takes the babe To his protection, calls him Posthumus Leonatus, Breeds him and makes him of his bedchamber, Puts to him all the learnings that his time Could make him the receiver of which he took, As we do air, fast as twas ministerd, And ins spring became a harvest, lived in court Which rare it is to domost praised, most loved, A sample to the youngest, to the more mature A glass that feated them, and to the graver A child that guided dotards to his mistress, For whom he now is banishd, her own price Proclaims how she esteemd him and his virtue By her election may be truly read What kind of man he is.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: I honour him Even out of your report. But, pray you, tell me, Is she sole child to the king

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: His only child. He had two sons: if this be worth your hearing, Mark it: the eldest of them at three years old, I the swathingclothes the other, from their nursery Were stoln, and to this hour no guess in knowledge Which way they went.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: How long is this ago

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Some twenty years.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: That a kings children should be so conveyd, So slackly guarded, and the search so slow, That could not trace them!

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Howsoeer tis strange, Or that the negligence may well be laughd at, Yet is it true, sir.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: I do well believe you.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: We must forbear: here comes the gentleman, The queen, and princess.
Exeunt
Enter the QUEEN, POSTHUMUS LEONATUS, and IMOGEN

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: No, be assured you shall not find me, daughter, After the slander of most stepmothers, Evileyed unto you: youre my prisoner, but Your gaoler shall deliver you the keys That lock up your restraint. For you, Posthumus, So soon as I can win the offended king, I will be known your advocate: marry, yet The fire of rage is in him, and twere good You leand unto his sentence with what patience Your wisdom may inform you.

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: Please your highness, I will from hence today.

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: You know the peril. Ill fetch a turn about the garden, pitying The pangs of barrd affections, though the king Hath charged you should not speak together.
Exit

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: O Dissembling courtesy! How fine this tyrant Can tickle where she wounds! My dearest husband, I something fear my fathers wrath but nothing Always reserved my holy dutywhat His rage can do on me: you must be gone And I shall here abide the hourly shot Of angry eyes, not comforted to live, But that there is this jewel in the world That I may see again.

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: My queen! my mistress! O lady, weep no more, lest I give cause To be suspected of more tenderness Than doth become a man. I will remain The loyalst husband that did eer plight troth: My residence in Rome at one Philarios, Who to my father was a friend, to me Known but by letter: thither write, my queen, And with mine eyes Ill drink the words you send, Though ink be made of gall.
Reenter QUEEN

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: Be brief, I pray you: If the king come, I shall incur I know not How much of his displeasure. Yet Ill move him To walk this way: I never do him wrong, But he does buy my injuries, to be friends Pays dear for my offences.
Aside
Exit

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: Should we be taking leave As long a term as yet we have to live, The loathness to depart would grow. Adieu!

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: Nay, stay a little: Were you but riding forth to air yourself, Such parting were too petty. Look here, love This diamond was my mothers: take it, heart But keep it till you woo another wife, When Imogen is dead.

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: How, how! another You gentle gods, give me but this I have, And sear up my embracements from a next With bonds of death! Remain, remain thou here While sense can keep it on. And, sweetest, fairest, As I my poor self did exchange for you, To your so infinite loss, so in our trifles I still win of you: for my sake wear this It is a manacle of love Ill place it Upon this fairest prisoner.
Putting on the ring
Putting a bracelet upon her arm

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: O the gods! When shall we see again
Enter CYMBELINE and Lords

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: Alack, the king!

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: Thou basest thing, avoid! hence, from my sight! If after this command thou fraught the court With thy unworthiness, thou diest: away! Thourt poison to my blood.

lines.speaker: posthumus leonatus
lines.text: The gods protect you! And bless the good remainders of the court! I am gone.
Exit

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: There cannot be a pinch in death More sharp than this is.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: O disloyal thing, That shouldst repair my youth, thou heapst A years age on me.

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: I beseech you, sir, Harm not yourself with your vexation I am senseless of your wrath a touch more rare Subdues all pangs, all fears.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: Past grace obedience

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: Past hope, and in despair that way, past grace.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: That mightst have had the sole son of my queen!

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: O blest, that I might not! I chose an eagle, And did avoid a puttock.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: Thou tookst a beggar wouldst have made my throne A seat for baseness.

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: No I rather added A lustre to it.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: O thou vile one!

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: Sir, It is your fault that I have loved Posthumus: You bred him as my playfellow, and he is A man worth any woman, overbuys me Almost the sum he pays.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: What, art thou mad

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: Almost, sir: heaven restore me! Would I were A neatherds daughter, and my Leonatus Our neighbour shepherds son!

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: Thou foolish thing! They were again together: you have done Not after our command. Away with her, And pen her up.
Reenter QUEEN

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: Beseech your patience. Peace, Dear lady daughter, peace! Sweet sovereign, Leave us to ourselves and make yourself some comfort Out of your best advice.

lines.speaker: cymbeline
lines.text: Nay, let her languish A drop of blood a day and, being aged, Die of this folly!
Exeunt CYMBELINE and Lords

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: Fie! you must give way. Here is your servant. How now, sir! What news
Enter PISANIO

lines.speaker: pisanio
lines.text: My lord your son drew on my master.

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: Ha! No harm, I trust, is done

lines.speaker: pisanio
lines.text: There might have been, But that my master rather playd than fought And had no help of anger: they were parted By gentlemen at hand.

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: I am very glad ont.

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: Your sons my fathers friend he takes his part. To draw upon an exile! O brave sir! I would they were in Afric both together Myself by with a needle, that I might prick The goerback. Why came you from your master

lines.speaker: pisanio
lines.text: On his command: he would not suffer me To bring him to the haven left these notes Of what commands I should be subject to, When t pleased you to employ me.

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: This hath been Your faithful servant: I dare lay mine honour He will remain so.

lines.speaker: pisanio
lines.text: I humbly thank your highness.

lines.speaker: queen
lines.text: Pray, walk awhile.

lines.speaker: imogen
lines.text: About some halfhour hence, I pray you, speak with me: you shall at least Go see my lord aboard: for this time leave me.
Exeunt
